isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Cleaning and Inspection

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, the oil cooler must be replaced if there was a bearing failure. Debris from a bearing failure cannot be removed from the oil cooler.

note.para: The best way to clean the crankcase during engine overhaul is in a chemical bath or hot tank. This removes all carbonaceous material and mineral deposits that collect in the cooling passages. If the hot tank is not available, use the following cleaning procedure.

step1.para: Clean all old gasket material from the surfaces of the crankcase, if any.
Remove the main oil gallery cup plug, located at the rear of the crankcase by using a hammer and chisel. Knockout main oil gallery cup plug.
With the plugs removed from the crankcase, clean the crankcase as follows:

step2.para: Use a nylon brush with soap and water to clean oil galleries.
Clean cross drillings using a nylon brush with soap and water.
Use filtered compressed air to blow out oil galleries and cross drillings.

Clean all threaded holes with an appropriately sized tap
.

step1.para: Install a new main oil gallery cup plug as follows:

step2.para: Clean the mating surfaces of the plug and crankcase.
Apply Loctite® 262 to the outside edge of the cup plug.
Use an arbor to drive the cup plug in. The arbor must be approximately 6 mm (¼ in) smaller in diameter than the plug that is being installed.

step1.para: Install new plugs in the rear of the crankcase.
Inspect the piston cooling tubes for damage and blockage as follows:

step2.para: Inspect both ends of the tube. Verify that the flanged end next to the bearing saddle is intact and the orifice end protruding from the crankcase is not broken. Replace any tubes that are damaged.
Hold tube under running water in a sink. Water should stream out of tube end. If not, blockage will have to be physically removed by compressed air or piston oil tube must be replaced.
